scenarioDescription:
The HD 6718 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 6718 is a star with 1.08 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.95 times its radius. It is located 167.46 light years away from the solar system.

HD 6718 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 6718 system


HD 6718 b

HD 6718 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2010-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 3.55 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 6718 b is 534.240 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 6718 b is 13.500 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 6718 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 6718, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: HD 6718 - System With 1 Exoplanet
